intro: Neobyrnesia, commonly known as the "milkweed tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Neobyrnesia species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
